S. Korean students protest dispatch of troops to Iraqi war 
    Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Students in South Korea reportedly staged a surprise demonstration in front of the "Defence Ministry" building in Ryongsan, Seoul, on April 30 in protest against the authorities' dispatch of troops to the Iraqi war.
 Upon hearing the news that the troops left for Iraq early in the morning, they expressed bitter indignation, throwing bottles of paint at the "ministry" building.    
 The protestors scattered handbills reading "we are opposed to the war killing even civilians for the profit of capitalists and the dispatch of troops to it."
